CHANGE.ITEM: Added TYPEs to DIVs in order to validate. Proofed title page(s). Check TEXT for LANG attribute. Reviewed structure. Checked division-marking material at heads and feet of divisions (HEADS, CLOSER, OPENER, ARGUMENT, EPIGRAPH, SIGNED, BYLINE, etc.). Checked placement and completeness of PBs. Check for blanks. Checked for signatures. Checked for #s. Checked for Qs, startqs, endqs, oes, q;s. Check LETTER tags. Check Ls. Check TABLEs. Check LISTs. Check NOTEs. Checked for FIGUREs and decorated initials. Checked for missing-page GAPs and duplicates. Checked proofsheets and made corrections found there. Corrected ** $-groups. Converted ** $-groups to GAP DESC="illegible" RESP="[vendor name]". Revalidated.

DIV1.HEAD: Province of the Massachusetts-Bay ss. seal By the HONORABLE, THE Lieutenant Governour, and Commander in Chief. A Proclamation. For Preventing and Punishing Immorality and Prophaneness.
DIV1.P: WHEREAS His Sacred Majesty in and by His Royal Proclamation of the Twenty fourth of February last, hath published His most pious Resolution to discountenance and punish all Vice, Immorality and Prophaneness, and to encourage and reward Virtue in all persons, from the highest to the lowest degree; Thereby setting a most rare and excellent Example to be viewed and followed by all His Subjects. Therefore being moved thereunto by the Assembly, and by, and with the Advice and Consent of the Council. I do direct and Command, all Iudges, Iustices of Peace, Grand-jurors, Constables, Tything-men, and all other Officers and Persons, in their respective Capacities, to do all that in them lies to detect discover, and bring forth all persons transgressing and offending against the wholesome Laws and Statutes made and provided for the Suppressing and punishing of Excessive Drinking, Blasphemy, prophane Swearing and Cursing, Lewdness, prophanation of the Lords Day, and other dissolute Immortal and disorderly practices; and to take effectual care, that the Laws made against such, be Vigorously put in Execution; as they tender the Honour of Almighty GOD, and the welfare, prosperity & quiet of themselves and their Neighbourhood: And that by the piety and virtue of their own Lives & Conversations, they do set good Examples, to incite others to a desirable Imitation thereof. Ordering that this Proclamation be Read in all Courts of Iustice within this Province, at the opening thereof, immediately before the charge be given to the Grand-jury.

CLOSER.DATELINE: Given under my Hand at Boston, the 16th. Day of June, 1698. In the Tenth Year of His Majesties Reign.

DIV1.P: BOSTON in New England, Printed by Bartholomew Green, and Iohn Allen. Printers to the GOVERNOUR and COUNCIL. 1698.
